Class CrapsGui

  • java.lang.Object
    • CrapsGui

  • public class CrapsGui
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is for creating a GUI for Craps. It features two images representing the players rolls, as well as other components that inform the user of other game information.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    James Crocker s4914680

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CrapsGui()
      This is the constructor for the CrapsGui object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CrapsGui

        public CrapsGui()
        This is the constructor for the CrapsGui object. It creates all the components for the GUI and then adds it to a panel, then onto a frame. It also initialises the game by setting the players money. It takes no inputs.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • frame

        public void frame()
        This method creates a frame for the GUI.

      • panel

        public void panel()
        This method creates a panel to hold the components of the GUI. It also colours it green.

      • diceImages

        public void diceImages(java.lang.String first,
                       java.lang.String second)
        This method is for creating two dice images and adding them to the panel. It takes in two strings that act as the file location of the images wanted to be displayed. It then adds them to the panel
        Parameters:
        first - The file location for the first image
        second - The file location for the second image

      • rollButton

        public void rollButton()
        This method creates the roll button that the user will click on to play the game. It makes use of the RollHandler() actionListener to add functionality. It then adds it to the panel.

      • labels

        public void labels()
        This method creates the labels for the GUI and adds them to the panel.

      • betField

        public void betField()
        This method creates the text field for the GUI and adds it to the panel.

      • resolveDiceImage

        public java.lang.String resolveDiceImage(int num)
        This method is for resolving an inputted number (1-6) to its corresponding image location. e.g. an inputted 1 will result in an outputted string "one.png". This String refers to an image file and is meant to be used to change the dice images. If a number outside of the range 1-6 is inputted it will output "one.png".
        Parameters:
        num - The inputted int to be resolved to a file location string.
        Returns:
        returns "one.png" when a 1 is inputted, "two.png" for 2, "three.png" for 3, and so on and so forth up to 6.

      • scoreboard

        public void scoreboard()
        This method is for creating the scoreboard and applying it to the GUI. At the moment it does not display scores ordered by the highest, instead by most recent. Unless there are five saves in the file already the scoreboard will not appear.

      • playerSave

        public void playerSave()
        This method is for creating the saveField and saveButton. The field takes the players name, and the button saves that and their money to a file using SaveHandler()
